commentary: A unique interlacing between contradictory concepts: Devotional idol worship and the all-pervading.
In this qawwali, the spiritual aspirant is analogized with the lover - the Beloved manifesting as the idol.
The non-responsive idol is analogized as the spurner - driving the desirer mad.
Ultimately, through this madness and devotion, the idol manifests as the Truth.
footnotes: [1] This line is a word for word translation, but has at least a few different valid interpretations.
[2] Perhaps a reference to 'loss of ego'.
[3] The curer meaning a reference perhaps to the Divine.
lyrics: lekar tumhara naam jaha sar jhuka diya
Taking your name, that place where I bowed my head:
maine ussi dayaar ko kaaba bana diya
I made that land the Holy Kaaba itself!
sar jhukaya toh patthar sanam bann gaye
As I bowed my head, my Beloved turned to stone:
ishq bhatka toh haq aashna ho gaya
Love became errant, and so my Beloved became the Truth [1].
rashq karta hai kaaba mere kufar par
Even the Kaaba is envious of my idolatry:
maine jis buth ko pooja khuda ho gaya
The idol I worshipped, became God itself!
gum rehi hai ke miraj hai ishq ki
As it remained lost, so love ascended.
aye junoon bol manzil hai yeh kaun si
This madness: Tell me, what sort of destination is this?
uske ghar ka pata poochte poochte
As I asked and asked, for its [love's] home.
poochne wala khud laapta ho gaya
The one who asked, himself, became lost! [2]
main mohabbat se muh mod leta agar
If I were to turn my head away from love:
toot padhti yeh bijli kisi aur par
Then this lightning strikes down upon someone else!
mere dil ki tabahi se yeh toh hua
At least this happened, from the destruction of my heart:
kam se kam dusron ka bhala ho gaya
At the very least, others attained prosperity.
waqt-e-ahbab parchai sooraj kiran
Dear friends only for a time: Shadows, the Sun, the Sun's rays,
log duniya khushi chaandni zindagi
...people, the world, happiness, the moonlight, and life itself!
mere mehboob ik tere gham ke siwa
My Beloved, except only for your sorrow:
jo mila raaste mein juda ho gaya
All else encountered on this path, has drifted away.
karobaar-e-tamana mein yeh to hua
At least this happened, from the trading of wishes:
unke kadmon pe marne ka mauka mila
I was given a chance - to die in their footsteps!
zindagi bhar toh ghata uthaate rahe
Throughout life, I've encountered only diminishments:
aaj pehli dafa faayda ho gaya
Today, for the first time, something has been gained.
aisa bhatka ke lauta nahi aaj tak
I became so errant, that I have not returned - to this day!
aisa bichchda ke aaya nahi aaj tak
I became so separated, that I never went back - to this day!
dil bi kambakht iska darman walla
My heart has good fortune, alas its curer...
aapke ghar gaya aapka ho gaya
I went to Your [the curer's] abode, and became only yours! [3]
